alert.note: Alert for Jackson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 2:22PM EST until January 09 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Graham, Jackson, Macon and Swain. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM EST, Localized excessive runoff will continue to work through the Little Tennessee and Tuckasegee River basins through late afternoon. Remain wary of above bankfull conditions of continued or renewed flooding of low-lying areas. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
